channel.title: art on l0.ai
channel.description: Recent content in art on l0.ai

item.title: Stable Diffusion Experiment 3
item.description: Imagining myself in new images Textual Inversion In an earlier post I referenced work on Textual Inversion that allows new concepts to be added to the Stable Diffusion model. Textual inversion trains a new set of embeddings that can be used to generate a new object or style you provide through pictures, by loading them into a model. I used textual inversion to generate some portraits of our pup, though this worked well and generated some beautiful images it wasn’t exactly like our dog.

item.title: Stable Diffusion Sketch 2-4
item.description: Sketch 2 Sketch 3 Sketch 4 As I continue to explore Stable Diffusion, I’m more and more impressed by a few things: some grasp of compositionality, wide breadth of concepts or semantics in the model and very impressive quality in it’s generations. The images below weren’t hand picked, I’ve put other generations here too. Sketch 2 Prompt: : “Low poly art of a floating island sourrounded by waterfalls with a japanese temple built with red wood, isometric art, 3d render, ray tracing, high detail, artstation, concept art, behance, smooth, sharp focus, ethereal lighting, unreal engine 5”
